Articles.Content: I hope i'm not breaking any rules here. But i would like to hear some ideas as to what 1.3 will carry.

Stock KER, life support, and more planets.  A bunch of topics from people complaining that the update broke all their favorite mods.  And a bunch more topics asking what people think will be in 1.3.1 or 1.4.
Localization, tweaks and bugfixes, maybe an art update. Betond that, not much, IMO.

8 hours ago, Hodari said:

Stock KER, life support

These are the top 2 things that should be in 1.3
Airplane parts. Every version that is hyped always ends up with just more airplane parts

14 minutes ago, RX2000 said:

These are the top 2 things that should be in 1.3

Stock KER sounds great, but If there is life support I would like there to be an option for NO life support

18 minutes ago, RX2000 said:

These are the top 2 things that should be in 1.3

I agree with KER but life support? Only if it can be switched off.

Also, the game needs more command modules..
I would prefer a 1.2.2+n set of releases over the next 6 months to address the bug list and allow the modding community to catch up with 1.2

Whether it's called 1.3 or 1.2.3, I'm guessing localization and bugfixes.  I get the impression that KSP is near it's final state.  Any future big features may be DLC.  

Edited January 8, 2017 by klgraham1013
Oh wow. Are we going to this AGAIN?

1 hour ago, Vinhero100 said:

Stock KER sounds great, but If there is life support I would like there to be an option for NO life support

Yeah, it definitely should be optional and possibly default to being turned off entirely on lower difficulty settings, but would be nice to at least have it available in stock.

1 hour ago, klgraham1013 said:

Any future big features may be DLC.  

Suggestions like that make me really nostalgic for the days of the pillory.

1 minute ago, Nathair said:

Suggestions like that make me really nostalgic for the days of the pillory.

We shouldn't expect updates to always be free.  KSP has been "1.0" for a while now.

6 minutes ago, klgraham1013 said:

We shouldn't expect updates to always be free.  KSP has been "1.0" for a while now.

'Scuse me a moment while I head out to the shop and whip up some stocks.
I'm hoping for stock life support. Now that we have an easier, stock kind of "remote tech," probes are harder than manned missions.

Following communications, life support should indeed be the next logical step.

But yeah, knowing Squad, we'll get localisation, bug fixes, more bugs, fire in the forums and a few rushed patches.
Hopefully a rocket part overhaul and a stock dV calculator.

Maybe Life support could be a difficulty-set option. For example, you can still turn it off via the Custom Difficulty, but it would be preset for hard(Or even medium, but lower consumption of supplies.)

I've been waiting for a new planet for nearly 4 years so that'd be nice. Of course things like clouds, scattering, life support, something... anything intertesting on the surfaces, better damage system than just *poof*, a story (through easter eggs like NovaSilisko planned)...etc. all sound like nice ideas but I don't expect that to happen. Improving the current and adding new planets should be doable in about one hour if Squad wanted so that seems pretty realistic but, again, I don't really expect anything at this point.

Honestly, I'd be perfectly happy with some new airplane parts, a completed rocket overhaul, and a simplistic cloud system. Lots more parts and a tiny bit of graphical improvement would go perfectly with the game at this point, as the last few "big updates" have added more realism to the game, which for some, makes the game more difficult to the point where it starts to lose it's fun. And yes, I know you can turn off reentry heat and comms, but, I think that adding life support so soon after could possibly be overwhelming for some players. And, also maybe rebalancing some of the systems recently implemented, like making heat shields ablate away faster at higher temperatures, effectively allowing for an infinite heat tolerance (assuming you have infinite ablator), and additions to 1.2's comm network stuff like optional signal delay, and a RemoteTech-like flight computer for planning maneuvers in advance. Proper aerodynamic shielding would be nice, too. 

 

Also, more story please!

Oh dear if they have life support for the next major imagine the trailer. Usually kerbals die in those trailers, and they usually die because of an accident involving a rocket. I'm a huge fan of dark humour, and I would love to see what kind of trailer SQUAD would put out for life support!

On 1/8/2017 at 0:11 AM, Hodari said:

And a bunch more topics asking what people think will be in 1.3.1 or 1.4.

And a bunch of replies like this one about it

On 1/8/2017 at 8:52 AM, Vinhero100 said:

Stock KER sounds great, but If there is life support I would like there to be an option for NO life support

After doing that with KerNet, I'd assume that people would demand it for later upgrades.  I don't like the idea of life support since it would reduce many chances for rescue missions.  I suspect that Harvester was pretty much the one blocking KER (or at least a delta-V calculator, I doubt that Squad wants *everything* that KER shows pasted all over the screen).

The mod breaking and people asking about the next version are things we can pretty much count on.
I'm hoping for some better tools for building surface bases. Hoses and forklifts, mainly.

Might be a longshot but...

Actually doing something with these other tabs?
